sentence.idiomatic: I've been in a bad mood lately; everything I do seems tedious.
I've attended too many of these kinds of meetings--so tedious.
How boring. I've been back for so many days, I haven't run into any friends.
It's at least five hours until we reach home.
I heard that there were at least 500 people that attended this event.
To buy a house here you need at least 1,000,000.
I haven't exercised for the entire summer vacation. Now I have a spare tire.
Lately I've been eating too much, plus I haven't exercised enough. Look, I've grown a spare tire.
Do you know what I need to do to be able to lose the spare tire on my belly?
Besides dieting, do you have any other good ways of losing weight?
In order to lose weight, she recently has been on a diet.
I have painstakingly dieted for over a month--surprisingly, I haven't gotten any thinner.

word.literal: to be unable to stand it
to be unable to stand it
